metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7443 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
apt-cacher before 1.7.15 and apt-cacher-ng before 3.4 allow HTTP responsesplitting via encoded newline characters, related to lack of blocking forthe %0[ad] regular expression.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7443` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apt-cacher-ng - 3-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

apt-cacher - 1.7.15
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apt-cacher-ng package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3-1').
apt-cacher package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.7.15').
